Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different land habitats, such as a playground, garden, forest, or parking lot.
The student can draw different water habitats, such as a pond, stream, or lake.
The student can include different types of plants, like trees, grasses, bushes, and flowering plants in their drawings.
The student can include different types of animals, like lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams in their drawings.
The student can show comparisons by drawing different living things found in each type of habitat.
The student can use their drawing to show patterns in how different plants and animals live in different habitats.
